alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 9:20PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Bell and south central Knox Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 920 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Trosper, or near Pineville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fourmile and Clear Creek Springs around 925 PM EDT. Pineville, Wallsend, Wasioto, East Pineville and Ferndale around 930 PM EDT. Straight Creek, Cary, Arjay, Ponza, Calvin, Blanche and Rella around 935 PM EDT. Miracle, Kettle Island and Varilla around 940 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Balkan, Callaway, Blackmont, Black Snake, Oaks, Stony Fork Junction and Cubage. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 8 and 18. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County near mile marker 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
